posts.author: gralf
posts.post_text: October 8, 2018 at 5:54 PM#6What you want is to block the edit-macro-command so the user is not able to view the macrolines?This is not possible on MA2. There is no way to absolutely lock or hide any content. Anybody can login als administrator and have access to anything. Locking objects like macros only prevents from deleting or changing the object until it's unlocked.Maybe there might a way with a LUA-plugin to scan the commandline for the command "edit macro" and then immediately close the macro editor when it was opened. But I don't think so.There are some tricks to use like disabling the CLI for the macro. This would prevent the command edit with pressing the macro inside the pool. But this only blocks basic users, no advanced users.Please report here if you have found any solution. This is interesting to me, too.Gralf
